intro: Sisyrinchium tenellum, commonly known as the slender blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in early spring, typically in clusters at the ends of its stems. Sisyrinchium tenellum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an attractive and resilient addition to native plant gardens.
